nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
### Webhook Node (Shopify Listener)
Setup Requirement: First, add the "Inventory Level Update" event in Shopify

Purpose: Listens for inventory updates from Shopify

Setup: Configured in Shopify settings; linked to n8n URL

Action: Triggers workflow on inventory level changes

Note: Ensure correct URL setup in Shopify for accurate triggers

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
### Function Node (Inventory Check)

Purpose: Processes inventory data from Shopify.
Action: Extracts available inventory and item ID

Logic: Determines if inventory is low (<4 items) or out of stock (0 items)

Note: Adjust thresholds as needed for different stock levels

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content: Checks if low_inventory is true (almost out of stock)

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content: Checks if out_of_stock is true (no stock left)

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
### Shopify graphql

Retrieves product variant, title, inventory quantity, and image.
Uses Shopify's GraphQL API for detailed data retrieval.

Endpoint to be customized: Replace store.myshopify.com in {{ $env.API_BASE_URL }} with your actual Shopify store's myshopify URL.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note5

parameters.content:
Discord1: Configured to send messages to Channel A

Discord2: Configured to send messages to Channel B.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note6

parameters.content:
## Low Stock & Sold Out Watcher for Shopify
This n8n workflow automates the process of monitoring inventory levels for Shopify products, ensuring timely updates and efficient stock management. 

It is designed to alert users when inventory levels are low or out of stock, integrating with Shopify's webhook system and providing notifications through Discord (can be changed to any messaging platform) with product images and details.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Webhook Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Webhook Workflow. This workflow integrates 7 different services: webhook, stickyNote, httpRequest, code, graphql. It contains 21 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 21
- **Node Types**: 7
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Webhook**: webhook
- **Code**: code
- **Low Inventory**: if
- **Out of stock**: if
- **HTTP Request**: httpRequest
- **HTTP Request1**: httpRequest
- **GraphQL1- shopify**: graphql
- **GraphQL -  shopify**: graphql
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- ... and 11 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
